ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Further developed my conversational and writing skills
Got more practice speaking and writing in Italian. Went deeper into grammar.
Greater proficiency in Italian, as well as a deeper understanding of the culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The asynchronous class on Friday was a great way to get to practice Italian skills outside the classroom along with the required language exchange program.
The asynchronous day was very nice. It made it a bit more flexible to get work done whilst really engaging with the language through films etc.
I think more exercises like the workbook exercises would be appreciated, and more practice for exams.
This class picked up right off L1 and L2 and was great for truly knowing the grammar.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Solid language class, a bit of a workload, but Ieft feeling like I could easily go to Italy and have conversations with people on the street with no problems.
Sure, If you want to keep practicing Italian I think it's worth it.
